page.title: 07DANBURY PALACE (CONTINUED)
page.content: The architecture of the palace is Mock Tudor.The palace is made of red brick. The turrets make it look like a castle.The tall chimneys climb towards the blue sky.Ivy has been grown on the wall and around the windows.There are lots of bushes and trees at the front of the building,built into a continuous pattern.It has paths between each bush and tree.The bushes go up and down just like the turrets on the palace roof.Around the back garden there is a high wall made of brick.At the front of the garden there is an avenue of oak trees.Inside the building there is a beautiful stone staircase going through the house. The palace building has 30 rooms. In the residential extension there are 76 bedrooms and lots of other rooms as well.That is why Danbury Palace has its role as the Management Centre.
